meanings.definition: The condition of having both male and female reproductive organs in the same individual.
meanings.sent1: In some animals, monoecisms allow them to reproduce without needing a mate.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the monoecisms of the plant to understand its unique reproductive system.
meanings.sent3: The monoecisms of the flower confused the bee, making it fly in circles trying to pollinate.
meanings.sent4: The monoecisms of the tree symbolized unity and balance in nature.
meanings.sent5: The textbook explained monoecisms using colorful illustrations to help students visualize the concept.

meanings.definition: The state of being monoecious, having separate male and female flowers on the same plant.
meanings.sent1: Gardening enthusiasts appreciate the beauty of monoecisms in their backyard plants.
meanings.sent2: The farmer carefully observed the monoecisms of the corn plant to ensure a good harvest.
meanings.sent3: The monoecisms of the sunflower made it a popular attraction for bees and butterflies.
meanings.sent4: The monoecisms of the garden symbolized harmony and diversity in nature.
meanings.sent5: Children learned about monoecisms in school and were amazed by the plant's unique structure.

meanings.definition: The presence of both staminate and pistillate flowers on the same plant.
meanings.sent1: Botanists study the monoecisms of plants to understand their reproductive strategies.
meanings.sent2: The monoecisms of the oak tree fascinated nature lovers who visited the park.
meanings.sent3: The monoecisms of the rose plant made it a popular subject for botanical illustrations.
meanings.sent4: The monoecisms of the forest highlighted the interconnectedness of plant life.
meanings.sent5: The farmer marveled at the monoecisms of the crop, knowing it would lead to a bountiful harvest.
